verses.text: 「我把這些事告訴了你們，使你們不致後退。

words.definition: not to the extent of, avoid

words.note: Lit. 'back-retreat'

verses.text: 人要把你們趕出會堂；並且時候要到，所有要殺害你們的人，以為這樣就是事奉 神。

words.note: A place of assembly for Jewish worship.
Refers to serving God or a deity.
The leading space `　` is often used in Bibles for reverence.

verses.text: 他們要作這些事，因為他們不認識父，也不認識我。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 我把這些事告訴了你們，讓你們到了那個時候，可以想起我告訴過你們了。我起初沒有把這些事告訴你們，因為我跟你們在一起。

words.definition: to be at, to be in

verses.text: 聖靈的工作「現在我要到那差我來的那裡去，你們中間並沒有人問：『你到哪裡去？』

words.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit, the third person of the Trinity.

words.definition: to go to, to arrive at

words.note: Used before negatives for emphasis.

words.definition: to arrive at, to go to

verses.text: 然而因為我把這些事告訴了你們，你們心裡就充滿憂愁。
但我要把實情告訴你們，我去是對你們有益的。如果我不去，保惠師就不會到你們這裡來；我若去了，就會差他到你們這裡來。

words.note: A title for the Holy Spirit. Lit. 'protecting and benefiting teacher'.
More formal than 如果 (rúguǒ).

verses.text: 他來了，就要在罪、在義、在審判各方面指證世人的罪。
在罪方面，是因為他們不信我；
在義方面，是因為我到父那裡去，你們就再看不見我；

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Often used as a resultative complement after another verb to indicate seeing.

verses.text: 在審判方面，是因為這世界的統治者已經受了審判。

words.note: Refers to divine judgment
Refers to divine judgment

verses.text: 「我還有許多事要告訴你們，可是你們現在擔當不了；

words.note: A verb suffix indicating inability to complete an action

verses.text: 只等真理的靈來了，他要引導你們進入一切真理。他不是憑著自己說話，而是把他聽見的都說出來，並且要把將來的事告訴你們。

words.note: Refers to spiritual or theological truth.
Contextually refers to the Holy Spirit.
Refers to spiritual or theological truth.

verses.text: 他要榮耀我，因為他要把從我那裡所領受的告訴你們。

words.note: Often used in a religious context for 'glorify God'.
Indicates a passive or past action
Often implies receiving spiritual truth or guidance.

verses.text: 父所有的一切，都是我的；所以我說，他要把從我那裡所領受的告訴你們。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Indicates a passive or past action
Often implies receiving spiritual truth or guidance.

verses.text: 你們的憂愁要變為喜樂「不久，你們不會再看見我；再過不久，你們還要看見我。」
於是他的門徒中有幾個彼此說：「他對我們說：『不久，你們不會看見我；再過不久，你們還要看見我。』又說：『因為我到父那裡去。』這是甚麼意思呢？」

words.note: Refers to God the Father in this context.

verses.text: 他們又說：「他所說的『不久』，是甚麼意思呢？我們不曉得他在講甚麼。」

words.note: Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase.
Here, it nominalizes the preceding verb phrase '他所說' (that which he said).

verses.text: 耶穌知道他們想問他，就說：「我所說的『不久，你們不會看見我；再過不久，你們還要看見我』，你們為了這話彼此議論嗎？
我實實在在告訴你們，你們要痛哭哀號，世人卻要歡喜；你們要憂愁，但你們的憂愁要變為喜樂。

words.note: A solemn and emphatic declaration, frequently used by Jesus.
Often used in religious or literary contexts to describe deep sorrow.
Often contrasts with believers in biblical texts.

verses.text: 婦人生產的時候會有憂愁，因為她的時候到了；但生了孩子以後，就不再記住那痛苦了，因為歡喜有一個人生到世上來。

words.note: Verb-complement structure indicating birth leading to a location.

verses.text: 現在你們也有憂愁；但我要再見你們，你們的心就會喜樂，你們的喜樂是沒有人能夠奪去的。

words.note: Here, it forms a nominal phrase 'that which is snatched away'.

verses.text: 到了那天，你們甚麼也不會問我了。我實實在在告訴你們，你們奉我的名無論向父求甚麼，他必定賜給你們。

words.note: Used with '不' to mean 'not... at all' or 'not even'.
Reduplicated form emphasizes sincerity or truth; common in biblical context (Amen, amen).
Literally 'to respectfully receive'; here used as 'in the name of'.
Refers to God the Father in this context.
More formal and polite than '給' (gěi), often used for gifts from superiors or divine beings.

verses.text: 你們向來沒有奉我的名求甚麼；現在你們祈求，就必定得著，讓你們的喜樂滿溢。

words.note: Literally 'to respectfully receive'; here used as 'in the name of'.
Often used metaphorically for emotions or blessings.

verses.text: 耶穌已經勝過世界「我用譬喻對你們說了這些事，時候要到，我不再用譬喻對你們說了，而是把關於父的事明明白白告訴你們。

words.note: Introduces object before verb, indicates disposition/effect.
Refers to God the Father in this context.
Reduplicated form for emphasis, meaning 'very clearly'.

verses.text: 到了那天，你們要奉我的名祈求，我不是說我要為你們請求父；

words.definition: in the name of, by order of
words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts.
Specifically refers to making earnest requests, often to a deity.
Used here to refer to God the Father.

verses.text: 父自己愛你們，因為你們已經愛我，並且信我是從 神那裡來的。

words.note: In a religious context, it signifies faith.
Refers to the divine being.

verses.text: 我從父那裡來，到了這世界；我又離開這世界，到父那裡去。」

words.note: Refers to the physical world or humanity.

verses.text: 門徒說：「你看，現在你是明說，不是用譬喻說了。

words.note: A follower or student, specifically of Jesus in the Bible.
To state something directly and without ambiguity.
A figure of speech, often a short allegorical story.

verses.text: 現在我們知道你是無所不知的，不需要人向你發問。因此，我們信你是從 神那裡來的。」

words.note: An idiom meaning 'to know everything'.
Often used to introduce a conclusion.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「現在你們信嗎？
看哪，時候要到，而且已經到了，你們要分散，各人到自己的地方去，只留下我獨自一個人。其實我不是獨自一個人，因為有父與我同在。

words.note: An exclamation to draw attention, common in biblical text.
Often used idiomatically with 獨自 to emphasize being completely alone.
Often used idiomatically with 獨自 to emphasize being completely alone.
Refers to God the Father in Christian contexts.
Refers to God's presence with people.

verses.text: 我把這些事告訴你們，是要使你們在我裡面有平安。在世上你們有患難，但你們放心，我已經勝了這世界。」

words.note: A core theological concept of spiritual peace.
Refers to the earthly realm; common in biblical language.
A significant biblical term for suffering and hardship.
